subject: Automobile Racing
organizations: National Assn of Stock Car Auto Racing
lead_paragraph: Ryan Newman, projected as a possible teammate for the two-time Nascar Cup champion Tony Stewart on his new team, will leave Penske Racing at the end of the season, Penske announced in a statement. Newman, 30, got a full-time Cup ride in 2002 and has notched 13 victories, including this year’s Daytona 500. In a statement, Newman gave no indication where he would race next season. Stewart announced last week that he would leave Joe Gibbs Racing at the end of 2008 to become a driver and a part-owner of the team currently known as Haas-CNC Racing. The name will be changed to Stewart-Haas.
